FAQ

What is CBD?

CBD oil is derived from hemp plants that have high levels of cannabidiol (CBD) while having low levels of THC. At PureKana, our CBD oils always have less than 0.3% THC. These extracts can be used for a variety of purposes. The cannabidiol (CBD) content of various CBD oil products across the entire market varies tremendously. This is because manufacturers source from hemp plants grown around the world, and also because they utilize different cultivation and extraction techniques. We produce CBD oil with a high concentration of CBD and THC levels below 0.3%.

What is CBD Oil?

Our hemp is grown and harvested organically in Kentucky. At PureKana, we use solvent-free CO2 extraction; in other words, using the CO2 from the air we breathe to extract the beneficial molecules.

How is CBD Oil Manufactured?

Our hemp is grown and harvested organically in Kentucky. At PureKana, we use solvent-free CO2 extraction; in other words, using the CO2 from the air we breathe to extract the beneficial molecules.
